content: Theres an aspect of all this spending that I haven't seen brought up. With all the bailouts being handed out, the govt can (and has) started handing out conditions for getting the money. For example, limiting CEO's compensations. While o-bots may say "Oh goodie!!!" to that one, ask yourself this, do you REALLY want to live in a country where the govt can dictate / control private enterprise in such intimate details? It, in effect, is a de facto nationalization of several industries from banking to automaking. It's possible that a mandate can come out bannig SUVs for instance. Again, THINK of the ramifactions before you flame SUVs and thier owners. Yes, it's time to fight this "back door" communionism.

content: quote: Originally posted by navy8086: Theres an aspect of all this spending that I haven't seen brought up. It, in effect, is a de facto nationalization of several industries from banking to automaking. It's possible that a mandate can come out bannig SUVs for instance. Again, THINK of the ramifactions before you flame SUVs and thier owners. Yes, it's time to fight this "back door" communionism. Why not? Those same corporations and banks have been dictating to the government for at least the past 30 years. Maybe it's time the shoe went onto the other foot for awhile. A lot of us here talk about the control big business has over our government and how they short-circuit and circumvent the will of The People, so maybe this is one way to break that control. If it is, it's change I can believe in.

content: quote: With all the bailouts being handed out, the govt can (and has) started handing out conditions for getting the money. There's one very simple way to get out from under the "conditions" ... pay back the bailout (w/interest thank you very much). I don't see the same problems with the conditions that have been imposed as you do ... though I do, for the most part, disagree with the bailouts in the first place. Perhaps you might compare what the government is doing to the banks to what the banks do unto you when you take out a loan or a credit card. A little bit of "turnaround is fair play" is good for the soul.
quote: With all the bailouts being handed out, the govt can (and has) started handing out conditions for getting the money.

content: I'm feeling a little better quality regulation in banking is a good thing. The fuxx who've been screwing with Joe sixpack and his wife buying a modest home need to be outed--they and their 9 figure bonus. That's why a ton a folks don't give a rats azz about the banks and mortgage imbeciles taking one up the patoot. It feels rigged...because it is and has been rigged by freeloaders and self important snobs--doesn't matter what party or their affiliation--crooks are crooks. I don't see De Facto Nationalization--only a little better handle on the books and some oversight on the ***** who have been in charge of the wealth. "You'd better be able to sandpaper a Bobcat's butt in a phone booth if you want some of this.
